message_1: What is the probability of correctly guessing a single letter in a substitution cipher if the cipher alphabet consists of 26 random English letters?
message_2: The probability of correctly guessing a single letter in a substitution cipher with an alphabet consisting of 26 random English letters is 1/26, or approximately 0.0385, or 3.85%. This is because there is only one correct letter out of the 26 possible letters.
